title: Sandugo
summary: The Sandugo was a blood compact, performed in the island of Bohol in the Philippines, between the Spanish explorer Miguel LÃ³pez de Legazpi and Datu Sikatuna the chieftain of Bohol on March 16, 1565, to seal their friendship as part of the tribal tradition. This is considered as the first treaty of friendship between the Spaniards and Filipinos. "Sandugo"  is a Visayan word which means "one blood".[1]
